heading: Tropical Waters & Remote Island Communities in the Caribbean
intro: 13-day Central America expedition cruise from Miami to Belize, Honduras, Colombia and Panama
sellingPoints: 13-day expedition cruise from Miami to Belize, Nicaragua, Panama and Colombia
See a mixture of colourful cities and beautiful remote islands around the Caribbean
Seek out wildlife such as turtles, dolphins, sharks, monkeys and iguanas
includedInfo:
Hotel

  • Overnight in Miami before the expedition cruise, including breakfast and lunch 

Transfers

  • Transfer from the hotel to the ship in Miami including an excursion before the expedition cruise and lunch

Expedition Cruise

  • A stay in a cabin of your choice 

  • Breakfast, lunch and dinner including beverages* in restaurants Aune and Fredheim 

  • À la carte restaurant Lindstrøm included for suite guests 

  • Complimentary tea and coffee 

  • Complimentary Wi-Fi on board† 

  • Complimentary reusable water bottle 

  • English-speaking Expedition Team who organise and accompany activities on board and ashore 

  • Range of included activities 

Onboard Activities

  • In-depth lectures and discussions hosted by experts on the Expedition Team 

  • Full use of our Science Center, small library and advanced biological and geological equipment 

  • Citizen Science Programme where you can assist with ongoing scientific research 

  • Photography tips and techniques for capturing landscape and wildlife from our onboard professional photographer 

  • Use of ship's hot tubs, infinity pool, panoramic sauna, outdoor and indoor gyms, and running track 

  • Yoga and meditation sessions with an instructor 

  • Informal gatherings with the crew for daily briefings 

Landing Activities

  • Escorted landings with small expedition boats 

  • Loan of boots, trekking poles and all equipment for activities 

  • Complimentary wind- and water-resistant expedition jacket 

  • Expedition photographers on hand to assist you 

Notes

  • All planned activities are subject to weather conditions 

  • Excursions and activities are subject to change 

  • Please make sure you meet entry and boarding requirements  

  • No gratuities expected
notIncludedInfo:
• International flights 

  • Travel insurance 

  • Luggage handling 

  • Optional shore excursions with our local partners 

  • Optional small-group activities with our Expedition Team 

  • Optional treatments in the onboard wellness and spa area

itinerary.heading: A night in Miami
itinerary.body:
Marvel at the glitz and glamour of Miami at night 

An overnight stay in Miami Beach is the perfect launchpad for your Caribbean expedition. A thriving metropolis with vibrant doses of Latin American, Caribbean, Asian and European influence, the ‘City of Neon’ is one of the world's most popular holiday destinations. 

Aside from white sandy beaches and clear teal waters, you can enjoy the Latin beats of glamorous South Beach or discover Cuban culture in Little Havana.  

We recommend starting your trip early with an optional Pre-Programme to give you more time to explore all the excitement that Miami has to offer.

itinerary.heading: The Expedition Begins
itinerary.body:
Explore the Art Deco delights of Miami  

Before you cruise from Florida to the Caribbean islands, you can spend the morning exploring colourful Miami Beach or Downtown Miami. 

Then you’ll enjoy an included excursion to explore the highlights of Miami and Little Havana, with lunch at the hotel or during the excursion, which ends at the pier.   

Then it's time to embark MS Roald Amundsen, where the first of many delicious meals awaits. You'll meet the crew and Expedition Team, who will be your guides and lecturers on your expedition.

itinerary.heading: Serenity at Sea
itinerary.body:
Discover all your expedition ship has to offer  

Your first two days at sea are the perfect opportunity to relax and acquaint yourself with the onboard comforts of your expedition ship. 

Pamper yourself in our Wellness Centre, take part in an art workshop or join a yoga session out on deck. Dine in style in one of our three restaurants and spend time on deck looking for marine wildlife.  

The Expedition Team will also help prepare you for your tropical island adventures, with lectures on oceanography, Mayan culture, coral reefs, and much more. You can also pick up tips from our onboard photographer to get those picture-perfect snaps.

itinerary.heading: Mayan heritage
itinerary.body:
Visit the ancient temple ruins of Belize 

We arrive in Belize City, a lively hub of shopping areas and seaside parks surrounded by colourful colonial architecture. For the perfect introduction to the city, the Old Belize train ride will take you through five exhibitions showcasing Belizean history and natural beauty. 

Today, we visit the well-preserved Altun Ha ruins, a wealthy trading town dating back 2,000 years. It has two main plazas and 13 structures, including ancient temples. Altun Ha is also rich in wildlife. Over 200 species of birds have been spotted here as well as tapir, armadillos and the white-tailed deer.

itinerary.heading: Belize’s natural wonder
itinerary.body:
Discover the undersea jungles of the Caribbean 

Belize’s famed barrier reef is the country’s pièce de resistance. A thrilling variety of sea life, lush cays and opportunities to participate in water activities await you. 

Wildlife thrives above and beneath the surface in this unique environment. The barrier is home to hundreds of fish species, exotic birds and endangered animals including American crocodiles, West Indian manatees and sea turtles.  

We’ll stay on the barrier for the day, allowing you to absorb the incredible biodiversity of coral ecosystems. Belizeans consider their reef to be their most important natural asset. Today, you’ll discover why.

itinerary.heading: Beautiful Útila
itinerary.body:
Step into this unfrequented underwater paradise 

Útila is considered one of the best places to dive in the world. But you don’t need to go below the water line to appreciate the unique beauty of this stunning island. Útila is an oasis of tranquillity hidden in the Caribbean Sea, as beautiful on the surface as it is underwater. 

Most of Útila’s inhabitants dwell around the island’s only town. Located on the southeastern shore, it’s surrounded by swamps and wetlands that are home to many species of birds. 

We’ll be here for the day, discovering what makes Útila unique, learning about its history, and exploring one of the best snorkelling destinations in the Caribbean.

itinerary.heading: Guanaja
itinerary.body:
Island Honduras

Guanaja is one of the Bay Islands of Honduras and is in the Caribbean. It is about 70 kilometers (43 mi) off the north coast of Honduras.

itinerary.heading: Remote Bobel Cay
itinerary.body:
See one of the least explored islands of Honduras 

If you’re dreaming of a place off the beaten track, today is a day of exploration around the small island of Bobel Cay, located off the coat of Honduras. The island used to be a resting place for lobster fishermen. 

We plan to anchor off the shallows and use our small expedition boats to explore the island, spot marine life, and enjoy the beautiful warm tropical waters.

itinerary.heading: Isla de Providencia
itinerary.body:
Discover the beauty of the Seaflower Biosphere Reserve 

Once a base for pirates, the real treasures of this remote Colombian island are its idyllic beaches, pristine waters and tropical wildlife. Hike to the island's highest point for some incredible views. You may even encounter iguanas and electric blue lizards.  

Hit by Hurricane Iona in 2020, the island is undergoing rebuilding works. Our visits are important in supporting local business and helping the community recover. 

Discover the beautiful coral reefs of UNESCO’s Seaflower Biosphere Reserve, dubbed the 'Sea of Seven Colours', and have the chance to snorkel among clownfish, turtles and manta rays.

itinerary.heading: UNESCO Marine Park
itinerary.body:
Experience paradise on Earth at Bocas Del Toro 

Our cruise continues to the clear blue waters and forested isles of Bocas del Toro. Here, we'll explore a stunning archipelago made up of nine main islands and hundreds of smaller ones.  

Now a UNESCO World Heritage Site, this National Marine Park is one of the world’s most biologically diverse places on Earth. Possible destinations include Red Frog Beach and the tropical rainforest of Solarte Island. 

Why not visit a sustainable cacao farm, or snorkel in Zapatilla Cay, the remote location for hit TV show Survivor.

itinerary.heading: Final Hidden Paradise - Escudo De Veraguas
itinerary.body:
Escudo De Veraguas 

Escudo de Veraguas is traditionally considered the birthplace of the Indigenous Ngöbe–Buglé people.  

Escudo de Veraguas is an island renowned for its abundant forests and clear waters.  This island is the exclusive destination where tourists may have the opportunity to encounter the elusive three-toed pygmy sloth. 

Today, we will navigate the amazing channel system of the island and meet the Ngäbe community.

itinerary.heading: Arrival at Colón
itinerary.body:
From the Caribbean to the Panama Canal 

Your expedition cruise concludes at Colón, the bustling Caribbean entrance to the Panama Canal.  

Not quite ready to end your adventure? Add on three extra nights with our optional Post-Programme, staying at a jungle lodge nestled in the rainforest next to the Chagres River.  

Or add a trip to Casco Viejo, arguably the most charismatic neighbourhood in Panama City. You can even book another expedition cruise that takes you through the locks of the Panama Canal and to the Pacific Ocean on the other side.

heading: Chilean Fjords – Highlights of Patagonia
intro: South America cruise | Chilean Fjords – Highlights of Patagonia
sellingPoints: Explore the glacial wonderland of the Chilean fjords on an expedition from Ushuaia to Valparaíso.
Sail from dramatic fjords to majestic glaciers, discovering nature reserves, national parks, remote communities and UNESCO-listed towns along the way.
Learn about the local culture, rich with folklore, traditions and colourful architecture.
includedInfo:
Flights

  • Flights in economy class from Germany to Ushuaia (via Buenos Aires) and from Santiago de Chile back to Germany, including all taxes, return Rail&Fly ticket

Hotel

  • Overnight in Buenos Aires before the expedition cruise, including breakfast

Transfers

  • Transfer from the hotel to the airport in Buenos Aires before the expedition cruise

  • Transfer from the Ushuaia airport to the ship, before the expedition cruise

Expedition Cruise

  • A stay in a cabin of your choice

  • Daily breakfast, lunch and dinner

  • Wine, beer and spirits available at meals and throughout the day and evening (subject to licensing laws, excludes premium drinks)

  • All day coffee, tea and soft drinks

  • Fine dining in restaurant Lindstrøm included for suite guests

  • A complimentary Ocean Bottle water bottle to refill on board and take home

  • Wind and waterproof expedition jacket

  • Professional photos from your trip taken by our onboard photographer

  • Complimentary Wi-Fi. Please note, streaming is not supported

  • Use of sauna, hot tubs, pool, fitness room, lounges and more

  • Gratuities included. Fantastic service is standard at HX – though if you’d like to leave something extra, it’s always appreciated

  • Range of included activities 

Onboard Activities

  • In-depth lectures and discussions hosted by our knowledgeable Expedition Team

  • Use of our Science Centre, including the library and advanced biological and geological equipment

  • Citizen Science Programme allows guests to assist with ongoing scientific research 

  • Professional onboard photographer gives tips and tricks for the best landscape and wildlife photos

  • Informal gatherings with the crew for daily briefings

  • Daily briefing with the Expedition Team about the plans for the next day

Landing Activities

  • Escorted landings with small expedition boats

  • Necessary equipment for activities, such as walking poles, will be provided on board on loan. Your HX travel documents will have a recommended packing list.

  • Expedition photographer on hand to assist you

Notes

  • All planned activities are subject to weather and ice conditions 

  • Excursions and activities are subject to change

  • Please make sure you meet all entry and boarding requirements  

  • Depending on your flight departure an overnight might be needed
notIncludedInfo:
• Additional overnight(s) if required due to international flight timings   

  • Travel insurance  

  • Luggage handling  

  • Optional shore excursions with our local partners  

  • Optional small-group activities with our Expedition Team  

  • Optional treatments in the onboard wellness and spa area

itinerary.heading: The beat of Buenos Aires
itinerary.body:
Feel the rhythm of bustling Buenos Aires 

Home to a proud and diverse community of porteños, or ‘people of the port’, Bueons Aires is a sensuous fusion of faded European splendour and Latin American panache. An overnight stay here is the ideal way to start your adventure.

There are plenty of places to explore, including many parrillas serving authentic Argentine steak. Or maybe you’d like to practise your dance moves in the famous hometown of the tango.  

Why not consider arriving a few days early to see all this vibrant city has to offer.

itinerary.heading: Setting sail from Ushuaia
itinerary.body:
Fly south to Ushuaia and board your ship 

You'll have an early start today as we head to the airport for our flight to Ushuaia. With its backdrop of snow-covered mountains, Ushuaia holds the proud, if often-disputed, title of the southernmost city in the world.   

MS Roald Amundsen is waiting in port for you. After picking up your expedition jacket and meeting your Expedition Team, settle in and explore the ship before enjoying the first of many delicious meals on board. Your adventure is officially underway.

itinerary.heading: Garibaldi Fjord
itinerary.body:
The sights and sounds of a glacier

The goal for the day is a scenic cruise within Garibaldi Fjord in Alberto de Agostini National Park, all the way up to Garibaldi Glacier. Here, the Andes tumble into the Pacific and great glaciers calve ice into the beautiful fjord. 

The area is also a UNESCO Biosphere Reserve, and its rich waters are home to seals, sea lions and many seabirds, including the impressive Andean Condor.

If conditions allow, we'll reach the Garibaldi Glacier at the head of the fjord, one of the most impressive glaciers in all of Chile.

itinerary.heading: Ainsworth Bay
itinerary.body:
Marinelli Glacier: A glacier in retreat

We continue our exploration of Alberto de Agostini National Park sailing the Almirantazgo Sound amid towering mountain peaks to pristine Ainsworth Bay, a coastal inlet fed by the Marinelli Glacier, a glacier in retreat.  

Here you’ll learn about the effects of glacial meltwater on local ecosystems and wildlife – a trend seen across the Southern Patagonian Ice Field. 

If local sea and weather conditions allow, we’ll explore the bay with our small expedition boats.

itinerary.heading: Stunning Chilean fjords
itinerary.body:
Through the Strait of Magellan and the White Narrows

As we sail north along the Chilean coast, join your Expedition Team for fascinating lectures on topics like pre-Columbian history, the geology of our surroundings, and the folklore of local communities. 

Enjoy the serenity and beauty of the maze of fjords we pass, surrounded by islands, glaciers, and steep mountains. And keep an eye out for elephant seals, dolphins, and whales, who often swim alongside the ship. 

Our resident photographer will be on hand to help you get the most from your wildlife and landscape photography. 

The next day, according to the tide, we’ll sail through the White Narrows into Puerto Natales. At only 100 metres (326 feet) wide in parts, this striking waterway between islets and sheer rock cliffs is only passable in slack water and daylight.  

Head out on deck to witness some of the most beautiful landscapes on the continent as your Captain skilfully navigates the ship through these famed channels.

itinerary.heading: Bohemian Puerto Natales
itinerary.body:
Gateway to Torres del Paine 

Today you’ll awake in Puerto Natales, gateway to the Torres del Paine National Park. The rugged landscape features steppe, forest, and desert, punctuated by glaciers and lakes, and you can choose to see it either on a panoramic bus tour or on a hike.  

Andean animals such as guanacos, rheas, and the elusive puma roam here. Look out for Chilean flamingos as well as the mighty Andean condor. 

Puerto Natales is a popular hub for hikers and adventurers, with many eateries, bars, andshops featuring outdoor equipment. Visit the artisan village at Etherh Aike or stroll along the photogenic waterfront.

itinerary.heading: Caleta Tortel
itinerary.body:
Receive a warm welcome in Caleta Tortel 

We continue off the well-trodden path to visit isolated Caleta Tortel. Lying at the mouth of Río Baker, Chile's largest river, this charming village is home to just 500 inhabitants.  

Instead of streets, a maze of boardwalks connects the close-knit community, spreading over water and around the mountain base.  

While exploring the village, you'll come across locals selling handicrafts and you may even be treated to a performance by folk dancers.

itinerary.heading: Sea day
itinerary.body:
Enjoy a day of scenic cruising 

Your expedition cruise continues north through the fabled waters of Patagonia. The seas here are captivating, with a whole palette of shades of blue, from the brightest aquamarine to the deepest midnight hues.  

As we sail, we’ll scout for whales, seabirds, seals and more. Take in the scenery from the panoramic sauna or on-deck hot tubs and infinity pool, enjoy the onboard cuisine, or relax in the Explorer Lounge & Bar. 

Your Expedition Team will be on hand with fascinating lectures on local history and wildlife, and our onboard photographer can help with tips on expedition photography.

itinerary.heading: Castro's Chilotan charm
itinerary.body:
Stilt houses and historic churches 

Set amidst the lush greenery of Chiloé Island, Castro is Chile’s third oldest city. It’s also home to two UNESCO World Heritage Sites – Iglesia San Francisco and Iglesia de Nuestra Señora de Gracia de Nercón. The former is one of the oldest colonial era buildings in the country and has survived 15 major earthquakes.    

Keep your camera ready for views of the city’s colourful palafitos – stilt houses along the waterfront. For insight into local culture, head to the Museo Regional de Castro and Modern Art Museum.

itinerary.heading: The fortress at Niebla
itinerary.body:
Explore a Spanish fortress and a lively market 

We go ashore at the pretty seaside town of Niebla, set on a picturesque peninsula with views of Corral Bay on one side and the Valdivia River on the other. Take a stroll on the wide sandy beach and, if the Feria Costumbrista market is open, sample traditional empanadas, anticuchos and churros.  

Aside from the town itself, the ruins of the old Spanish fort and its associated museum are well worth a visit. Learn more about the region's history at the museum, then wander around the lighthouse. You'll enjoy beautiful views across the river and bay.

itinerary.heading: Relax at sea
itinerary.body:
At Sea 

Your expedition cruise continues along the Pacific coast to Valparaíso, our final stop. Now, as our journey nears its end, take some time to reflect on the experiences you’ve had so far. Perhaps you’ve met some kindred spirits along the way, and maybe you’re even thinking ahead to your next adventure.  

There will be a chance to enjoy a recap of our shared experiences in Patagonia and the fjords from our Expedition Team. And seeing as you’re at sea, you may as well take full advantage of all the great onboard facilities the ship offers – and enjoy a final fantastic evening meal.

itinerary.heading: UNESCO’s `Jewel of the Pacific´
itinerary.body:
End your voyage in colourful Valparaíso

Your South American expedition cruise ends in Valparaíso, the 'Jewel of the Pacific'. Built on steep hillsides overlooking the ocean, it's well worth spending time in this UNESCO-listed city before you fly home. 

Filled with attractions, the city is an intriguing mix of winding alleyways, colourful houses, and mercados packed with local produce. Why not take it all in on a funicular ride up to Cerro Alegre and Concepción. 

From Valparaiso you´ll be transferred to the airport in Santiago de Chile. Your journey ends with your flight back to Germany. 

Although your cruise has come to an end, the adventure doesn’t have to stop there. Why not consider joining our optional Post-Programmes.

heading: From Lisbon to Portsmouth - Europe´s Atlantic Highlights
intro: Experience a kaleidoscope of history and culture on this incredible cruise from Lisbon to Portsmouth along Europe’s Atlantic Coast, taking in Northern Spain and Brittany. On this 15-day adventure, you’ll visit UNESCO World Heritage Sites, enjoy spectacular coastal scenery, delight in regional gastronomy and wine, across six diverse European nations.
includedInfo:
Expedition Cruise

  • Expedition cruise in a cabin of your choice

  • Breakfast, lunch and dinner including beverages (house beer and wine, sodas, and mineral water) in restaurants Aune and Fredheim

  • À la carte restaurant Lindstrøm included for suite guests

  • Complimentary tea and coffee

  • Complimentary Wi-Fi on board. Be aware that we sail in remote areas with limited connection. Streaming is not supported.

  • Complimentary reusable water bottle to use at water refill stations on board

  • English-speaking Expedition Team who organise and accompany activities on board and ashore

  • Range of included activities

Onboard Activities

  • Experts on the Expedition Team deliver in-depth lectures on a variety of topics

  • Use of the ship’s Science Center which has an extensive library and advanced biological and geological microscopes

  • Citizen Science program allows guests to assist with live scientific research

  • Professional onboard photographer gives top tips and tricks for the best landscape and wildlife photos

  • Use of the ship’s hot tubs, panoramic sauna, outdoor and indoor gyms and outdoor running track

  • Informal gatherings with the crew such as daily recaps and preparation for the day to come

Landing Activities

  • Complimentary wind and water-resistant expedition jacket

  • Expedition Photographers help with your camera settings before landings
notIncludedInfo:
• International flights

  • Travel insurance

  • Luggage handling

  • Optional shore excursions with our local partners

  • Optional small-group activities with our Expedition Team

  • Optional treatments in the onboard wellness and spa area
notes:
• All planned activities are subject to weather and ice conditions

  • Excursions and activities are subject to change

  • Please make sure you meet all entry and boarding requirements

  • No gratuities expected

itinerary.heading: The delights of Lisbon
itinerary.body:
One of southern Europe's most enchanting cities

Your adventure begins in Lisbon. To give yourself time to explore, why not extend your stay an extra night or join our optional Pre-Programme for a sightseeing tour of the city.

The Portuguese capital is rich in history and culture. If you have time, take a stroll through the classical districts of Baixa and Bairro Alto, Alfama and the old Islamic quarter, visiting the remains of the Roman amphitheatre and the Moorish fortress.

You can also visit the beautiful UNESCO World Heritage Sites of Torre de Belém and Mosteiro dos Jerónimos a little further from the city centre, where you'll also find the delicious pastéis de Belém.

itinerary.heading: Charming Porto
itinerary.body:
Explore the UNESCO-listed historic centre of Porto

Our first stop is Leixoes, Portugal. From here, you can see the Lighthouse of Leça, the Chapel of Boa Nova and the beautiful Praia Azul beach. 

Included today is a walking tour of nearby Porto – famed for its port wine and UNESCO-listed historic centre. Its undulating streets are made for strolling, with pastel houses, colourful tiled facades, street art, ornate churches and panoramic views across the Douro.

Stroll along the bustling Ribeira Docks promenade, cross the Dom Luís I bridge, snack on delicious petiscos and enjoy wine tastings at the port cellars of Vila Nova de Gaia.

itinerary.heading: Galician Coast and Ferrol
itinerary.body:
Ferrol, in Galicia, is the start of the Camino Ingles

We reach Ferrol, one of the best-preserved examples of an 18th century port city. Criss-cross Barrio de la Magdalena's 'chessboard grid' of streets, and explore maritime museums. Or venture northwest to Costa de Artabra, with its spectacular coastal landscapes.

You can sample local dishes like pulpo á feira, octopus with potatoes and paprika, in eateries along the Playa de los Doniños and Playa de San Xurxo beaches.

Camino Ingles, one of the Camino de Santiago pilgrimage routes, starts in Ferrol. You can join an optional excursion direct to charming Santiago de Compostela, one the most important Catholic sites in the world.

itinerary.heading: Golden sands of Gijón
itinerary.body:
Savour a different cultural flavour in Asturias

Enjoying a prime position along the Bay of Biscay, Gijón, the cultural heart of Asturias, has grown from a small fishing village settled by the Romans into a prominent port city.

You can experience its old town charm on a stroll through the Cimadevilla and Barrio del Carmen districts, exploring beautiful Baroque churches and the Plaza del Marques of the Old Quarter. Or climb the hilly peninsula of Cimadevilla, Gijón’s historic centre.

Then relax on the golden sands of Playa de San Lorenzo, enjoy a coastal walk, or savour freshly caught fish and other Asturian delicacies, accompanied by a glass of refreshing local cider.

itinerary.heading: Explore San Sebastián
itinerary.body:
Experience the jewel of the Basque Country

Your expedition cruise continues to the Basque region. You'll love the energy of San Sebastián – which offers something for everyone – surfers, food lovers, culture buffs.

Visit the historic district of Parte Vieja with its Gothic church, Baroque facades and beautiful squares. You can relax on La Concha beach or take a cable car to Monte Igueldo; while the steep ascent up Monte Urgull will reward you with fantastic bay views from its fortifications.

Make sure you find time to sample some traditional Basque cuisine. The delicious pintxos are perfect small bites to devour as you tour the city.

itinerary.heading: Bordeaux, City of Wine
itinerary.body:
Raise a glass in Bordeaux, the City of Wine

Bordeaux's old town is a UNESCO World Heritage site, bursting with culture and craft at every turn. From the famous water mirror at Place de la Bourse, to the French Gothic Cathedral de St André and the Musée des Beaux-Arts, if you love art and architecture, you're spoilt for choice.

But it's wine that's the true soul of Bordeaux. With over 8,500 chateaux and producers in the region, and vineyards just a short tram ride from town, you can taste and compare some of the 60 appellations, from the stellar Red Bordeaux Supérieur to sweet Sauternes.

itinerary.heading: Ile d’Aix, Emperor's Isle
itinerary.body:
A tiny island with a grand military history

You'll find it hard to believe that this pretty little island has played a role in all the wars France has fought in, from the Middle Ages to the Second World War. Today, Ile d’Aix, with its quaint and colourful houses, can be peacefully explored by foot or bike.

Your visit will reveal a Vauban-style fort village, and the Napoleonic Museum, detailing the Emperor’s stay on the island, before he was exiled.

If it's tranquillity you're after, head to the island’s five white sand beaches. The island is also a birder's paradise, with over 200 species of bird that call the island home.

itinerary.heading: Wild beauty in Brittany
itinerary.body:
Experience Brittany's wild Morbihan coastline

Immerse yourself in Breton culture as we spend the day exploring the region of Morbihan. It's home to Brittany's finest natural scenery and sights, like the craggy cliffs of the Côte Sauvage, the medieval city of Vannes, and the Carnac Stones that rival Stonehenge.

We may anchor on Quiberon Bay, from where you can join optional excursions to historic sites. If we anchor at Belle Île, you’ll discover its formidable 17th century fortress – Citadelle Vauban – in the charming port of Le Palais. Visit Les Aiguilles de Port Coton, famously painted by Claude Monet, take a coastal walk or relax on Donnant beach.

itinerary.heading: Land's End at Finistère
itinerary.body:
Inspiring coastal scenery and maritime history

Finistère is a picturesque region of colourful quaysides, beautiful beaches and craggy cliff faces. We’ll visit one of two ports today – Douarnenez or Brest – depending on conditions, but will enjoy the same excursion programme. The coastal landscape around Douarnenez inspired both Renoir and Boudin, and will take your breath away. Its fishermen’s huts and seaman chapels are romantic reminders of its fishing heritage. Alternatively, we'll explore the lively quays and docks of Brest, a fascinating maritime city. Visit the National Naval Museum or enjoy a cable car ride with breathtaking views of Brest and the Recouvrance Bridge.

itinerary.heading: The Citadel of Saint-Malo
itinerary.body:
A beautiful town steeped in history

Viewed from the sea, Saint-Malo is an impressive sight, fringed by fortified bastions and shallow beaches. A circular walk along the ramparts offers the best views of the town and surrounding islands. Take a tour of the Privateers house to learn about the ruthless Corsairs and the town’s pirate heritage.

You can also follow the historical trail within the old city walls through a maze of cobbled streets. The Gothic-style St Vincent Cathedral and the Chateau de la Duchesse Anne are worth a visit. And at low tide, you can walk to the fortified island, Le Grand-Bé, where famous local writer Chateaubriand is buried.

itinerary.heading: Cruising the Channel
itinerary.body:
Enjoy time on board

You have the whole day on board to relax on deck, maybe in the pool or hot tub. Or head to the Science Center, where you can contribute to one of our Citizen Science projects, as we navigate the waters between continental Europe and the British Isles.

While the British call it the English Channel, it’s known on the continent as La Manche, 'The Sleeve', or simply, 'The Channel'. Whatever the name, it's an important seaway, handling a quarter of the world's maritime trade.

Enjoy the day's lecture and recaps from the Expedition Team, get editing tips from our onboard photographer, or take in the sea views over a drink from our Explorer Lounge.

itinerary.heading: Potter around Harlingen
itinerary.body:
Experience the Frisian port city of Harlingen

You can walk or bike around Harlingen – a city of canals, pretty harbours and home to the last traditional pottery factory in the Netherlands. It lies on the shores of the Wadden Sea, a UNESCO World Heritage area.

In the Old Town, look out for heritage sites like the 46 Stumbling Stones, memorialising 46 Jewish residents murdered during the Nazi occupation.

Around the old harbours of Noorderhaven and Zuiderhaven, you'll find traditional sailing ships and historic warehouses. The reproduction of Arctic explorer William Barents' expedition ship is nearby, as is the Harlingen Aardewerk Museum, showcasing Frisian pottery.

itinerary.heading: Historical Hamburg
itinerary.body:
Explore Hamburg's architectural and cultural delights

Our expedition cruise continues to Germany – Hamburg, the 'Venice of the North', so-called for its pretty canals. If you're leaving us here, consider booking our Hamburg Post-Programme to explore more.

You'll discover most of the city's attractions in the Altstadt, including St Nikolai Memorial and Deichstraße Historic Street. You'll also find two UNESCO World Heritage Sites – Chilehaus and the world's largest warehouse complex. Art lovers will enjoy Kunsthalle, Germany’s foremost art museum.

You can also visit the old floating dock of Landungsbrücken, see the old ships and yards, waterfront buildings, and the Old Elbe Tunnel.

itinerary.heading: A final day at sea
itinerary.body:
Portsmouth bound, it's time to relax and reflect

Your illuminating European expedition cruises towards the UK, along the southern shores of England to Portsmouth harbour, where our journey ends.

Our Expedition Team will be on hand to answer more questions, and offer the final lectures of our expedition, as you relax – perhaps thinking about fascinating destinations you'd like to explore with us next time.

Join fellow guests in the Explorer Lounge & Bar and relive your wonderful experiences of Europe's Atlantic coast as you compare highlights of your journey – from Portugal to Northern Spain, France, the Netherlands and Germany.

itinerary.heading: Arrival in Portsmouth
itinerary.body:
A city with a proud naval heritage

We dock in Portsmouth, where our adventure comes to an end. If you have time, you can explore the city – a perfect end to your expedition cruise around Europe.

Portsmouth Historic Dockyard is a highlight for any naval history fan. Spend a day exploring Nelson’s HMS Victory, Tudor ship Mary Rose and warship HMS Warrior. Discover the D-Day story in Southsea, or simply take a stroll on the beach.

Alternatively, head for charming Old Portsmouth, where if you’re feeling adventurous, you can even abseil down Spinnaker Tower. Whatever you decide, we hope you'll take home fantastic memories of your European Atlantic coastal exploration.

heading: Expedition Cruise to the White Sea – Norway and Russia Adventure
intro: Explore Norway’s coast as we cross the Arctic Circle, before venturing east to Russia’s White Sea. Join us for an exhilarating cruise visiting settlements rich in fishing traditions and Sámi history, as well as the iconic Solovetsky Islands. We’ll hope to see spectacular autumn hues, snow-topped mountains and – just maybe – the magical glow of the Northern Lights.
includedInfo:
Expedition Cruise

  • Expedition cruise in a cabin of your choice

  • Breakfast, lunch and dinner including beverages (house beer and wine, sodas, and mineral water) in restaurants Aune

  • Complimentary tea and coffee

  • Complimentary Wi-Fi on board. Be aware that we sail in remote areas with limited connection. Streaming is not supported.

  • Complimentary reusable water bottle to use at water refill stations on board

  • English-speaking Expedition Team who organise and accompany activities on board and ashore

  • Range of included activities

Onboard Activities

  • Experts on the Expedition Team deliver in-depth lectures on a variety of topics

  • Use of the ship’s Science Center which has an extensive library and advanced biological and geological microscopes

  • Citizen Science program allows guests to assist with live scientific research

  • Professional onboard photographer gives top tips and tricks for the best landscape and wildlife photos

  • Use of the ship’s hot tubs, panoramic sauna and indoor gym

  • Informal gatherings with the crew such as daily recaps and preparation for the day to come

Landing Activities

  • Escorted landings with small expedition boats

  • Complimentary wind and water-resistant expedition jacket

  • Expedition Photographers help with your camera settings
notIncludedInfo:
• Air Travel

  • Travel insurance

  • Luggage handling

  • Optional shore excursions with our local partners

  • Optional small-group activities with our Expedition Team
notes:
• All planned activities are subject to weather and ice conditions

  • Excursions and activities are subject to change

  • For this voyage a single-entry visa to Russia is required. Please make sure you meet all entry and boarding requirements.

  • No gratuities expected

itinerary.heading: Set sail from Bergen
itinerary.body:
Visit UNESCO-listed Bryggen and Mount Fløyen

Your expedition cruise begins in beautiful Bergen. Surrounded by mountains and the sea, the old capital is one of Norway’s most picturesque cities. Join our Pre-Programme for a guided tour of the sights, including the famous Bryggen district, with its colourful wooden wharfs. If you have time, take the funicular railway up to the summit of Mount Fløyen for amazing views over the city. Then it's time to board MS Spitsbergen, the ideal ship to navigate the Norwegian coastline and Russia's White Sea up close.

Settle in to your cabin, meet your expert Expedition Team, and enjoy your first dinner aboard as we sail towards Hjørundfjorden.

itinerary.heading: Stunning Hjørundfjorden
itinerary.body:
Lofty peaks, still waters and traditional farms lie off the tourist track

The Norwegian fjords are famed for their breathtaking beauty. Even so, Hjørundfjorden will amaze you. This natural wonder, far from the well-trodden tourist track, is one of the purest and most beautiful fjords in Norway Still waters are surrounded by the majestic Sunnmore Alps. A few tiny farms dot the shoreline – your Expedition Team will explain the traditional methods that the farmers use to work this tricky terrain, handed down for generations. We’ll anchor close to one of the settlements and head ashore to explore the scenic landscape in the crisp autumn air.

itinerary.heading: Sailing north
itinerary.body:
Time to fully explore your ship and prepare for the Northern Lights

As your cruise heads to the picture-perfect Lofoten Islands, you’ll have time to see all MS Spitsbergen has to offer.

Work out in the gym or be pampered in the Wellness Spa. Soak in one of the hot tubs, or relax in the panoramic sauna and watch the landscapes slip by. Over the next few days, we may see the Northern Lights. Your Expedition Team will give you tips for capturing the colours on camera, as well as delivering informative, interactive sessions in the Explorer Lounge. These are a great way to bring your destinations to life, with a mix of fascinating facts and marvellous myths.

itinerary.heading: The Lofoten Islands
itinerary.body:
Pretty villages nestle among untamed mountain peaks

The starkly beautiful Lofoten islands – with a rich Viking heritage – combine dramatic peaks, sheltered coves, sandy beaches and pristine waters.

The winter fishing season has been a way of life here for centuries, when Arctic cod come here to spawn. You’ll see fishing villages, with their cabins – or rorbu – set out in rows along the shore. You might even spot the fishermen's wooden racks air-drying cod.

Svolvær, the biggest town on the archipelago, is close to Lofoten’s many magnificent sights. Here you can enjoy activities such as kayaking, hiking and expedition boating, or simply a wander round the shops, galleries and cafés.

itinerary.heading: Picture-perfect Sommarøy
itinerary.body:
Embrace this welcoming island community and its outdoor pursuits

Nestled amid astonishingly blue waters and majestic mountain scenery, Sommarøy is a small village with plenty to see and do.

One of the best ways to experience local life is to visit the village shop. Here you’ll find the Kaillkråa, a cosy corner where friends catch up. You’ll be warmly welcomed if you’d like to pull up a chair and join the conversation.

You can also choose one of our optional excursions, hiking in the peaceful hills or kayaking in the crystal island waters. Or visit nearby Tromsø – the ‘Gateway to the Arctic’ – which we'll also return to later as our final stop on your cruise.

itinerary.heading: The North Cape
itinerary.body:
Visit the North Cape – at the top of the world

From the fishing village of Skarsvåg, you'll enjoy an included excursion to the mountain plateau of the North Cape.

At just 1,300 miles from the Geographic North Pole, it's one of the northernmost points in Europe. Enjoy cliff-edge views out to sea, take a selfie at the Globe Monument, then visit the cinema to see a short film about the plateau and exhibits about the island’s history. You can also an optional walk with the Expedition Team to Kirkeporten viewpoint, a natural arch in the rock. You’ll want a scenic snap of the extraordinary hornet, a formation remarkably like an animal horn.

itinerary.heading: Trading history of Vardø
itinerary.body:
Step back in time in Norway’s easternmost settlement

Our final stop in Norway is Vardø. This was an important trading centre for Russia’s Pomor people and those of northern Norway. The fascinating economic and cultural connections are explained in the Pomor Museum. The darker side of the town’s history is commemorated by the extraordinary witch monument, a memorial to the 91 people tried and executed for witchcraft in the 17th century. A visit to the museum at Vardøhus Fortress, where the accused were held, is recommended. If you’d like to explore the wider area more, your Expedition Team will lead you on a nature walk.

itinerary.heading: Welcome to Russia
itinerary.body:
Exploring the maritime and military history of Murmansk

The Russian leg of our expedition begins in the largest city north of the Arctic Circle: Murmansk. Its streets hold many monuments celebrating its history and achievements. You’ll see the first before we land. A 115ft Russian WW2 soldier stands at the port, memorialising those who gave their lives. Elsewhere Lenin, the world’s first nuclear icebreaker, is an interactive museum telling the history of the icebreaker fleet. From here on, the ever-changing conditions will make your cruise unique. Our Expedition Team will adapt each day to create the most memorable itinerary for you.

itinerary.heading: Journey to the White Sea
itinerary.body:
Preparing for the unspoilt marvels ahead with your Expedition Team

Sailing into the White Sea was forbidden for many years. Together with its geographically remote location, that means its rich history and incredible natural beauty remain a mystery to many.

There’s a great deal to discover as we head for Arkhangelsk. Our journey follows Pomor trade routes around the coastline of the Barents Sea.

On the way your Expedition Team and their Russian colleagues will tell you about the destinations ahead. They’ll discuss subjects such as life in the far north of Russia, the area’s trading histor,y and the fascinating cultures of the Sámi and Pomor peoples.

itinerary.heading: Russia’s cultural capital
itinerary.body:
A stunning seaport with centuries of history to explore

Arkhangelsk was the chief port of medieval and early modern Russia, and has been an important seaport, trading, and shipbuilding centre for centuries. Key industries are fishing and timber – this last you can see from the architecture. The beautifully-preserved buildings of Malye Korely open-air museum showcase the incredible talent of artisans down the ages. Arkhangelsk’s history incorporates everything from Soviet times to Peter the Great. There’s much to learn, so the Lore Museum in the Merchant Yard is worth a visit. Want a true taste of history? Try kozoola, traditional Pomor gingerbread.

itinerary.heading: Pearls of the White Sea
itinerary.body:
Discover the history and beauty of this UNESCO World Heritage Site

The Solovetsky Islands are sometimes called ‘the pearls of the White Sea’ – and it’s easy to see why. Their incredible history is surpassed only by their astonishing beauty. You’ll visit Solovetsky Monastery on Bolshoy Solovetsky, which grew into a huge medieval political power and became a massive fortified citadel. Standing against a hauntingly beautiful and stunningly remote background, it’s a sight you won’t ever forget Both the Monastery and the Solovetsky islands are UNESCO World Heritage sites, and a standing monument to the extraordinary history of this endlessly-fascinating country.

itinerary.heading: The Kola Peninsula
itinerary.body:
Natural harbours and scattered settlements where tradition is still strong

Autumn is a changeable time, so our itinerary for the Kola Peninsula will depend on tides and weather conditions. Today's goal is to reach Chapoma or Pyalitsa, traditional settlements of houses built from wood and natural materials.

People here still rely on traditional fishing and hunting methods used by original settlers. If we’re able to land, you’ll really appreciate the challenges that face those who call this area home. At the same time the wild remoteness of the landscape and views across the White Sea create a strangely delicate beauty that you’ll want to capture on camera.

itinerary.heading: Relax at sea
itinerary.body:
Sit back and reflect on your adventures so far

After an enjoyable few days exploring some of the secrets that the White Sea has to offer, you’ll welcome the chance to relax as we sail back towards the Norwegian border. Your Expedition Team will look back over your journey so far, answering any questions you may have and helping you fill in any gaps in what you’ve learned. They’ll also talk about what’s planned for the final leg of your expedition. This is also a great time to make the most of your onboard facilities, from the gym, sauna and hot tub to the Wellness Spa and Explorer Lounge.

itinerary.heading: Return to Murmansk
itinerary.body:
Another chance to experience the city's history and people

There’s so much to experience in Murmansk that you'll appreciate a second visit. You’ll have time to explore further and learn more about life in the largest city north of the Arctic Circle. Take time to visit the Lighthouse Memorial and Church of the Saviour on the Waters. Together they form a complex dedicated to the memory of Murmansk sailors, military and civilians who lost their lives at sea. You'll great a feel for this modern city and its people by popping into its many restaurants and bars. And don't forget to pick up a souvenir on your last day in Russia.

itinerary.heading: Troms og Finnmarken
itinerary.body:
Exploring the Barents Sea

Any true expedition is all about adapting to conditions and today is no exception. Our aim is to get as close as we can to the rugged Norwegian coastline.

Landscapes in the Barents Sea vary from barren coastal areas facing the sea, to more sheltered fjord areas and river valleys with gullies and trees.

We’ll explore the area of Troms og Finnmarken, seeking a suitable fjord, island or bay to anchor in. Then we’ll use small expedition boats to go ashore and see what discoveries we can make.

itinerary.heading: Awe-inspiring Lyngen Alps
itinerary.body:
Enjoy a taste of traditional life at the foot of the Lyngen Alps

This morning you'll arrive at a sparkling fjord at the base of the awe-inspiring Lyngen Alps and the charming coastal trading post of Havnnes. Characterised by old, white-painted houses peeking over the waterline, this tiny town sends you back to the days of steam and sail. Visit the warehouse where locals use centuries-old methods to cure stockfish or the vintage general store. The local museum features an exhibition about Annie Giæver, who photographed local life during the early 20th century. If the weather is kind to us, we’ll explore the spectacular surroundings by kayak or on foot.

itinerary.heading: Arriving at Tromsø
itinerary.body:
Tromsø is a town of many sights – that may include the Northern Lights

Your expedition cruise to the White Sea reaches journey's end in Tromsø. You can choose to extend your adventure with our optional Post-Programme – enjoy an extra night and a trip around the city, plus a ride on the Fjellheisen cable car. Even if you can’t extend your stay, it’s worth taking time to explore the city’s attractions. Those might include the Northern Lights, so keep your cameras handy. The cable car offers breathtaking views of the city and surrounding countryside. Or visit Ølhallen, the town’s oldest pub, for a beer from the world’s northernmost brewery, Mack.
